conclusion: Analyze the graph of particle's position x as a function of time t.
Graph shows a straight line with a negative slope.
Particle's position x decreases over time t.
At t = 0, particle is at rest and position is 6 meters.
Slope of the line represents particle's velocity.
Negative slope indicates particle is moving in the negative direction of the x-axis.
Acceleration is the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
Since velocity is negative, acceleration is also negative.
Magnitude of acceleration is the absolute value of the derivative of velocity with respect to time.
Derivative dv/dt is negative, so magnitude of acceleration a is negative.
Magnitude of acceleration a is -6 m/s².
Magnitude of particle's acceleration is -6 m/s².
